climbs.name: South Park The Movie
climbs.fa: Jaaron and others, maybe others in the early '70s or '80s

content.protection: Small trad rack up to a number two Camalot, tri-cams, small nuts, runners and at least 13 draws for the second pitch. All anchors are bolted. Wear a helmet.
content.location: To get to the base of the climb, you can either hike your way South around the cliff to the base or you can rappel the route. The rappel is easiest with two 70 meter ropes, but can also be done with a single 60. To start the rap, find the tree with a black rap anchor on it. If using two 70s, rap to The Broken Bit Saloon ledge. From the ledge, rap to the ground. If you are using a single 60m or 70m, you will have to make five raps using the intermediate anchors.

climbs.name: Oh My God, They Drilled Kenny!

content.description: A new set of anchors have been added to rap down this route with one 60m rope.  The second pitch is the money, and is best enjoyed as one long pitch out.
content.protection:
Small trad rack plus seven bolts to top.  Anchors at bottom and top of long seconds pitch.  A variation crosses over from

South Park the Movie

to the bolted section of Oh My God, They Drilled Kenny and is called the "Lazy Wiggler Traverse."
content.location:
Route is approximately fifty feet to the left of

South Park the Movie

.  Top anchors are left and nearly even with the top anchors of

SPTM

.  Rap down twice with one rope to lower anchors-start climb here.  Climb starts out with fun crack climbing, and then turns to face climbing between bolts and some small gear.  This pitch is approximately 165' long.
